text: Preparation is a ghost town in Monona County, in the U.S. state of Iowa. ==History== Preparation was founded in 1853 by a commune of Mormons led by Charles B. Thompson. The community was named from their belief that life on Earth was a preparation for the afterlife. A post office was established at Preparation in 1854, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1904. The site of Preparation is now a part of Preparation Canyon State Park. ==References== Category:Geography of Monona County, Iowa Category:Ghost towns in Iowa Category:Populated places established in 1853 Category:1853 establishments in Iowa
